abstract: New York Yankees strength and conditioning coach Matt Krause adds running up specially designed hill to training regimen for players; Krause argues that hill's nine-degree incline sharpens angle of runner's shins and forces proper body lean, promoting better form.

headline.print_headline: Yanks Hope New Workout Area Puts Them on Upward Trajectory
headline.main: Yankees Hope New Workout Area Puts Them on Upward Trajectory

snippet: Steinbrenner Field’s 10-foot-tall mound with a 30-yard incline that players sprint up is “just another tool in the toolbox,” said Matt Krause, the team’s strength and conditioning coach.
lead_paragraph: Steinbrenner Field’s 10-foot-tall mound with a 30-yard incline that players sprint up is “just another tool in the toolbox,” said Matt Krause, the team’s strength and conditioning coach.
